reviews.review: Im not sure what to say other than: frustrating.

Simplesmente o melhor jogo que já joguei...
História incrível, cheio de mistério e um gameplay muito simples e fluído.
100% recomendado.
Ah, a Elizabeth parece uma pessoa de verdade, desde a interação completa com o cenário até o jeito que ela fala com o Booker e o trata.
Increible juego... sin palabras *_*
не ну это пиздец поный. Рекомендую.
I cant even explain how much i love this game, and this series. If you enjoy shooters, this game, and every other bioshock is a must.
Epic story, epic graphics this is just a must play !

Endlich mal ein Shooter, der eine geniale Story und ein brilliantes Gameplay bietet. Kein Feststecken bei geoverpowerten Bossen oder Rätsel, die nur mit Komplettlösung zu schaffen sind. Eine schöne Atmo bietet dieses Abenteuer auch. ICh spiele mit einer Nvidia Geforce GT 240M und mit einer GTX 770. Natürlich sieht man einen deutlichen Unterschied aber auch die GT 240M- Version kann sich blicken lassen. Dazu muss man aber noch sagan, dass bei einer mittleren und manchmal auch bei einer niedrigen Grafikeinstellung (GT 240M) kleine Lags, die allerdings  mit einer neuen Buffering-Methode sehr schnell wieder vorbei sind, vorkommen können. Insgesamt war ich hoch erfreut und habe ein ein neues meiner Lieblingsspiele gefunden. 
PS: Big Daddy aus den ersten beiden Teilen wurde hier leider rausgenommen.

Muito bom...
Cheio de surpresas e muitos tiros.
Para quem quer novidades e muita drenalina.

Sliding down a zipline accross a city in the middle of the clouds, throwing fire and lighting at your enemies who are attacking you on zeppelins while you dodge bullets and fire an RPG at a 10ft tall robotic George Washington who's got wings shaped like American flags and is firing a crank-driven gatling gun at you? Count me in!
Amazing freaking game, do not miss out on this masterpiece
Muito Bom
So much POWER.
Captivating Story. Alluring Graphics. Enchanting Combat.

I wasn't a fan of the first game and didn't want to continue the series afterwards. Then I saw this on sale and figured why not. I was not disappointed by my decision. This game is fairly deep in terms of story and has a pretty neat plot twist. The combat is very fluid and gave me a huge rush. I didn't feel like I was mindlessly gunning down enemies at any point in the game because there was so many different ways to approach combat. My only compliant about the game is that I can only hold two guns at a time but other than that its pretty great. 8/10 really recommend.

Прошел. Игрой очень доволен. Враги нервы не раз потрепали =)

Épico. Apaixonante. Inesquecível.

São poucas as palavras que conseguem descrever a experiência que Bioshock Infinite proporciona. Definitivamente um dos melhores games que joguei em toda a minha vida.

É importante dizer, antes de mais nada, que Bioshock Infinite, apesar de se passar no mesmo universo de seus antecessores, não é uma continuação e pode ser apreciado mesmo sem a ter jogado Bioshock 1 e 2. Por conta disso, Bioshock Infinite é bastante independente. Toda as inovações já criadas na série foram repensadas nesse capítulo.

No entanto, a mecânica básica continua a mesma: arma na mão direita, Plasmids (ou nesse caso Vigors) na mão esquerda. Diferente do seu antecessor, os Vigors podem ser acessados a qualquer momento. No lugar dos perks, agora temos Gear, que são peças de roupas (chapéu, camisa, calça e sapato) que você pode usar e trocar a qualquer momento que alteram os atributos de seu personagem. Agora todas as armas e Vigors podem ser melhorados comprando upgrades nas Vending Machines ao longo do jogo. E se você acha que vai conseguir dar upgrade em 100%, esqueça, não dá. Ou seja, pense com cautela onde irá investir a rara grana que você encontra no jogo. Não tem mais Adam ou Big Daddys ou Little Sisters. E não vou dizer o que mais o game tem, pois eu sei que vou estragar a surpresa. Mas agora, o foco do game é outro: A HISTÓRIA.

Bioshock Infinite resolveu um problema que já levantei no review anterior de Bioshock 2 http://steamcommunity.com/id/salvego/recommended/8850/. A história continua muito complexa, mas a narrativa agora é muito mais clara e direta. Você sabe onde está e o que está fazendo e também tem claro quais os motivos de o estar fazendo. Bioshock Infinite apresenta a história de Columbia, uma cidade nos céus liderada por uma forte crença entre o Profeta e o Falso Pastor. A influência da religião na cidade é muito evidente. O preconceito racial muito forte. A perfeição do povo e da cidade mascara a podridão de suas fundações. Nesse capítulo a interação com outros persongens faz com que a narrativa flua mais tranquilamente, principalmente em parceria com a belíssima Elizabeth. Eis aqui uma das inovações que Bioshock Infinite apresenta: a conexão criada entre você e Elizabeth é extremamente forte e você sente isso a cada sala, a cada passo, a cada ação. Elizabeth não só te ajuda na batalha, como comenta cada detalhe do ambiente onde você está, analisa a situação, te ajuda em suas decisões. É uma parceira de valor durante o jogo e não apenas um NPC falante. Veja o doc com 7 minutos só sobre a criação de Elizabeth:

http://youtu.be/frwhNLzmc-M

A ARTE de Bioshock Infinite é simplesmente de fazer qualquer um passar mal. Passar mal de verdade mesmo. A união visual e musical é perfeita. Reconheci várias peças, que, percebe-se, escolhidas a dedo: Chopin, Mozart, Bach. A história contada através da arte de Bioshock me fez suspirar muitas vezes. E como sempre digo em meus reviews, o CUIDADO que a equipe da Irrational Games teve com o game demonstra que não mediram esforços para deixar tudo como deveria ser: PERFEITO. Resumindo Bioshock Infinite, não é apenas um jogo de tiro. É uma obra de arte cuidadosamente planejada e executada. Não é apenas entretenimento passageiro, mas uma peça que irá ser lembrada e comentada por várias gerações de games.

Se David Cage queria inovar com os seus Heavy Rain e Beyond, obrigando jogadores a esmurrar botões para assistir um filminho, afirmando que games podem ser "filmes interativos", meu caro, ele deveria fazer um curso com Kevin Levine para entender do que se trata games e como uma história pode ser contada através de experiências interativas, transmitindo emoção, ação, amor e ódio. Meus caros, Kevin Levine é um ótimo contador de histórias que soube usar a mídia de games de forma magistral.

E fica aqui a lição para o mercado: esse game não tem Multiplayer, não tem modo competitivo, não tem coop. É só uma história muito bem contada. Os desenvolvedores só investiram tempo naquilo que merecia.

Foram 13 horas de gameplay, boa parte dessas horas apenas apreciando a arte, a decoração, a arquitetura, ouvindo as músicas e sons dos ambientes e prestando a atenção nos diálogos dos cidadãos de Columbia. Bioshock Infinite usa todo o poder dos games para tirar lágrimas. Assim que terminei o game já tive vontade de jogá-lo de novo! E vou fazer 100% dele (já sei que o 1999 mode é extremamente difícil) e não vejo a hora de experimentar o DLC. Um game para ser lembrado e jogado para sempre.

Não vou mostrar screenshots nesse review, por que espero que você veja com seus próprios olhos o que esse game representa. Nenhum screenshot ou vídeo conseguirá mostrar isso. Então o que está esperando??? Não perca mais tempo com os pew-pew-pew, e vá jogar um game de verdade, BIOSHOCK INFINITE!!!

This game, was incredible. I had never really gotten into a Bioshock game before, but the triple pack was on sale and I figured, why not?
First off, I would like to say that the story is awesome. I felt so attatched to Elizabeth and actually cared whether or not I protected her. Secondly, I wanted to know more about Booker! Why is he going after her? Why is everything so connected? And Thirdly, THAT ENDING! 

This is a fantastic game, and I would recommend it to everyone!

The only thing this game has going for it is it's beautiful graphics. The story is terrible in general and hard to follow especially if you're comparing it to its prequels. If you played the first two games, just skip this one. The gameplay mechanics are worst (the main example is that they introduce a stupid and mindless mechanic of "press F to receive a reward from Elizabeth", which interrupts all combat, and makes you invulnerable during the action so there is no strategy involved, just press F anytime the game tells you to and receive your reward) and interface for dealing with the vending machines is still not improved, the entire game is very linear and there are no choices to make.

[If you are wondering about the stats, I completed the game on my alt account, and bought it on this one for the DLCs since the discount was so good]

Gonna have to say no to this one.

Here's what you gotta understand about Bioshock: it's a story-based game with a very specific lore. Lore requires a sort of "scientific magic" to be present to give the atmosphere it's unique charm and it is also used for gameplay. That's just it: it's used in [b]atmosphere[/b] and [b]gameplay[/b]. Is does [u]not[/u] work as a centerpiece of the storyline. Story in Bioshock games has always been about morality. It's been about "How much is "too much"?". Infinite takes a turn in a different direction of pseudo-scientific plot twists (hence the name), in it's attempt to surprise the player, and unfortuntaley fails at is big time.

The story in infinite revolves around the a splified and twsited version of the alternate dimensions theory(ies), and without spoiling anything for you I can say one thing: the big plot twist of the game is basically this:

"LOL all this shit you did doesn't matter because the variable x in world 0x62756c6c736869742331 has crossed variable y at location (6,6,6) since rabbit stepped on his carrot that turned out to be a big daddy and eat the coordinate at a dinner party with ID 0x637261636b. I know this all shit is confusing and nonsensical, but you, the player, just need to understand that all you did was a giant waste of time. Plot twist! Ovations please!"

The Mass Effect 3 syndrome™ is present in full with this game, where writers tried too hard to surprise and "mystify" the player and this Elizabeth character and ended up going way over their heads.

The game is also quite linear. Where I was hoping for hubs to explore, side-quests to take, people to help/hinder and affect the outcome of the main story with that, I found chocies that are only forced and meaningless (no effect on the story), no hubs, no side-quests and wholly linear level design and story (which makes sense for the latter since all you do is a waste of time so what's the point in making different variations and giving you chocies?). 

The world of the game is great and certainly up to par and Elizabeth is also well-integrated into gameplay in a way that doesn't frustrate you, but also gives her an important role. But due to linearity and lack of interaction (the aforementioned lack of hubs and exploration), getting better aquanted withe the world is not really an option and the bits where you can observe the lore, are mostly set gallery pieces, with very limited interaction, the only exception being the beginning of the game at the festival, that lets you participate in activities (but not properly talk to people and no side-quests obviously).

While having it's moments, Infinite is most certainly a big let down for me due to contrived and over-complicated storyline and linearity. I can only recommend it at a good discount (60% and less) and certainly not full price.

Quite simply, this game is fantastic. The story is amazing - I was pulled in from the start and I felt compelled to continue playing to find out more. The graphics, even on this computer with Intel integrated graphics, were beautiful and the environments were exciting to explore. I could break this down further but, ultimately, I think it was all awesome with one exception:

It was too short - I finished the main content in 12 hours. It looks like Burial at Sea ep. 1 should offer at least a few more hours of game play and there is other DLC that might add more so that helps a bit but I'm still a bit disappointed that it doesn't have more content.

Habs gerade durch und muss sagen, ich bin überwältigt. Zwar nicht von dem Shooter-Gameplay,
 das ich als durchschnittlich bis schlecht empfand, aber von der Story und der überzeugenden Welt.

 Mit Columbia wurde eine sehr tiefgründige Welt erschaffen, voller Patriotismus, Rassismus und religiösem Fanatismus. Man spielt die ersten Minuten und wird sofort in die Welt hineingesogen. Es gibt viele kleine Details, wie etwa ein Jahrmarkt, den nur die priviligierten Bewohner betreten dürfen, oder zwei reiche Schnösel die auf einer Parkbank sitzen und über den 'Pöbel' fluchen. Da habe ich mir aber ein Bisschen mehr erhoft. Leider wirken viele Themen nur angefangen, verlieren aber gegen Ende des Spiels an Bedeutung. Genauer möchte ich aber nicht darauf eingehen, wegen den Spoilern.
Trozdem fand ich wärend dem ganzen Spielablauf immer wieder viele kleine Details, die einem eine sehr lebendige Welt vorspielen.

In dieser Faszinierenden Welt gibt es natürlich auch eine Story, die gerade gegen Ende hin sehr zum Nachdenken anregt und auch noch lange in Erinnerung bleibt. Zum Inhalt kann man eigentlich vorab nur sagen, dass man möglichst wenig von der Story wissen sollte, dem jedes kleine Detail kann im Spielverlauf schon einiges Spoilern. Zusagen ist nur noch, dass die Story auch zu einem erneuten Durchspielen motiviert, da es beim zweiten mal sehr viele 'Aha' 'Natürlich' Momente gibt und sich die ganze Welt nochmal ein Bisschen besser erschliesst. 

Schade nur, dass man um diese fesselnde Welt und die spannende Story ein so maues Gameplay gemacht hat. Ein typischer 08-15 Shooter. Nicht unspielbar, aber eben auch nicht das, was eigentlich das ganze Drumherum verdient hätte. Für Leute (wie mich :D) die das Spiel vorallem wegen der Story spielen woll(t)en, ist zum Glück ein 'Durch rushen' durch die Shooterparts einigermassen möglich, da sich der Schwierigkeitsgrad in Grenzen hält.

Ich empfehle das Spiel eigentlich jedem, der wiedermal eine richtig packende Story und Welt erleben will und sich nicht von den Shootereinlagen zu stark stören lässt. Achja, die ersten beiden Teile muss man nicht unbedingt gespielt haben (ich habe sie nicht gespielt) um einigermassen alles zu kapieren. Es gibt aber für Kenner der ersten Teile durchaus einige Anspielungen.
Simplemente genial de principio a fin.

What an experience. The action, gameplay, and mechanics are all outstanding. But what really got me was the story and the characters. It was like acting out a really good sci-fi novel. Bioshock Infinite is not just another nice looking shooter with a story tacked on at the last minute. This game was written with impeccable attention to detail and really telling an interesting an engaging story. And I personaly have never felt as emotionally involved with a game as I have this one. I cared about Elizabeth like a person, not just as entertainment on my computer. There were times in the game I felt myself getting angry or depressed by what was happening, particularly with Elizabth. It pulls you through the game and makes you not want to stop until you've not just beaten the game, but actaully seen you mission through.
If you want another COD style shooter, this might not be for you. But if you want to finish the game and still be thinking about the carachters as if they were real people hours later, give it a try. It's an experience.

Idea carina, peccato per il motore grafico che sente gli anni, la bassissima interattività con lo scenario e la storia che all'inizio sembra carina, poi inizia a diventare poco plausibile (sempre restando nel tema dell'ambientazione eh, non nella vita reale), poi torna a sembrare una figata, poi di nuovo sfancula e poi arriva il finale che ti fa dire "ma io che cazzo l'ho giocato a fare se tanto alla fine succede quello che succede?"  

Un gioco con un grande potenziale (anche solo per i prequel che in realtà sono sequel ma va beh), che però si perde nelle sue stesse seghe mentali della storia. 

6,5 su 10 giusto perché almeno all'inizio era bello. 

Consigliato giusto quando è in sconto al 75% o più.

Best FPS of 2013 and my fav of the series...

Der, der Bioshock 1 geliebt hat, wird mit Teil 3 so einige Probleme haben. 
Wer nicht ganz so kritisch ist bekommt einen Grundsoliden Shooter der viel auf eine fantastische und recht konfuse Story Wert legt. 

Die Grafik geht stark Richtung "Atemberaubend", die Steuerung ist Genretypisch.  Alles Solide.

Negativ sind definitiv die "Schlauchlevels". Zu sehr Liniear die ganze Sache. Sicherlich, man kann in den Abschnitten nach so einigen Sachen suchen, Geld für upgrades, irgendwelche Schätze, was auch immer. Aber trotzdem geht´s dann geradeaus weiter.  Sehr schön kaschiert.

ICh hab Bioshock infinite im Angebot für 7.49 € gekauft und bin begeister für den Preis. Tolle Story und "normaler" Shooter. 

7,5 / 10

*Edited* After finishing the Game and DLC I have decided to recommend the game.  It was a fresh take on the series and the gameplay and characters were interesting.  While i stand by my arguement that the gameplay is a tad boring and the bosses are horrible... the game itself is worth a playthru if only for the amazing atmosphere and story.

I played this on the 360, and now on the pc. 

Not sure why i decided to play it through again since i found this game lacking. 
The game itself is infact worth playing. 

I loved the linconbots, they were a laugh, also the who idea of tares in timelines i found pretty entertaining.

But if i wanted les miserable in a videogame, i would rather watch Russell Crowe choke.

It is infact the same engine as they have used in all the bioshock games, witch becomes pretty damn bland very quickly. Nothing new to offer except for drinking the dna recoding powers, and not having to listen to "would you kindly" nine million times...

The whole game was easly figuared out in a tottal of an hour or less of playing it...
The whole game is nothing but fun, but that is the problem...
 A game should fallow all  the way through or at least have a story that builds in due time...
This one throws people to kill at you, hoping your not playing attention to the flow of the game... it is too constant with all the shooting.... What is the point? Well it is a fps.. but it could of been a little more involved in slowing the pace down of the storyline and the action. 

It really ruined the flow... and that is to blame to the developer..
Take you damn time next time to pace yourselves!

I do have to say, the game itself was getting good, untill your opening doors to diffrent splices of time that you and your ........ well elizabeth visit only to tell you what you had figured out due to all the cutsenes they throw at you closer to the end of the game... 

I was pumped, i was all in and excited till... it happened.... the end of the game...

IS UNFORGIVABLE! 

You thought the ending to Mass Effect3 was bad... these two games should get married if it was legal! 
Or possilbe...


And this is how they cover their tracks!

They are now out with a dlc....

*FACEPALM*
With the same engine.. same booker.. and elizabeth all hookered out and no longer the sweet and innocent... in rapture...
Re used npc's ,and movie like actions that if you cut them out the time you spend playing the dlc all together that by the way you pay fifteen dollars for is only 2-3 or less.. hours long. 

Oh... the videogames we play in this dawn of age, crap it is i have to say. 

But if you can get Bioshock infinite, it is worth it, just dont hold your breath... 

Anyways, happy playing!

An excellent gameplay experience topped off with great visuals and a mindbending storyline played by great actors. Yes, it involves elements which are part of a new approach to the traditional Bioshock formula, and it won’t satisfy every single person, but it will definitely satisfy a vast majority. It’s actually a game that is quite easy to get attached to, as evidenced by the substantial fan base that has cropped up. If you’re worried about the new things, don’t be. Things like a 2-weapon inventory and the vigor system are simply new spins that create a combat style that is no less fun or deep than the ones in the games before it. You’ll come for the gameplay, and get swept up in the visuals and story.

Nachdem ich zu meiner Schande "BioShock"  und "BioShock 2" übersprungen habe, bin ich direkt beim dritten und leider letzten Teil, "BioShock Infinite", gelandet. Volltreffer! Das Spiel hat mich auf ganzer Linie überzeugt.
Zur Story, auf die ich aufgrund ihrer Vielfältigkeit und um nicht zu viel zu verraten nur kurzgefasst eingehen möchte: In diesem großartigen Ego-Shooter spielt man den ehemaligen Pinkerton-Detektiv Booker DeWitt, der um Schulden zu begleichen den Auftrag erhalten hat, das Mädchen Elizabeth zu befreien. Diese wird in ihrem Gefängnis vom mechanischen Vogel Songbird bewacht. Man reist in die wunderschön gestaltete fliegende Stadt Columbia, die aber im Spielverlauf immer mehr ihre hässlichen Seiten zeigt. Es tobt ein Bürgerkrieg zwischen der Polizei und der Vox Populi, einer Rebellengruppe. Schnell wird der Spieler, welcher in den Konflikt hineingezogen wird, als Feind angesehen und verfolgt. Aber um unseren Auftrag zu erledigen, müssen wir hier durch. Und: Wer hätte geahnt, dass Songbird uns im Spielverlauf noch nützlich werden kann? 
"BioShock Infinite" macht aber nicht allein wegen der tollen Story Spaß zu spielen, sondern auch wegen dem nahezu perfekten Gameplay. Leicht entsteht das Gefühl nie einen anderen Shooter gespielt zu haben, so ideal wurde es vom Entwickler "Irrational Games" umgesetzt. Nicht zuletzt die liebevoll gestaltete Grafik macht dieses Spiel zu einem der besten seinesgleichen. Einzig die Herausforderung hat mir etwas gefehlt, aber ich denke auf der höchsten Schwierigkeitsstufe, die ich noch nicht gespielt habe, sollte auch dieser Punkt wieder durchaus positiv ausfallen.
Ein insgesamt sehr emotionales und mitreißendes Spiel, das den Spieler fesselt und ihm somit die "Echtheit" des Geschehens berührend übermittelt. Schade, dass der Entwickler dicht gemacht hat und somit keinen weiteren Teil der "BioShock"-Reihe entwickeln wird. Uneingeschränkt von mir zu empfehlen und nun werde ich mich nachträglich, besser spät als nie und voller Vorfreude, in die Tiefen des Meeres zur Unterwasserstadt Rapture begeben!

All you do in this game is look at the ground while looting corpses. You go to one area kill 8 guys then stare at the ground looting corpses. Rinse and repeat. Who the fuck likes this shit. Boss battles are fucking lame cause you kill them then LOOK AT THE FUCKING GROUND TO LOOT 3 MORE SILVER FUCKING PIECES. Cant enjoy the scenery or any of the details and art in the game because you are too busy looking at the GROUND.

To quote someone else, Bioshock Infinite is wasted potential. 

The art deco, like Bioshock, is amazing. But, just like Bioshock again, any topics they bring up like racism for example has no commentary or explanation for it which is just bad. This is because it makes the setting and characters feel shallow, and because commentary and explanation can be interesting and informative in it's own right. 

The interactions between Booker and Elizabeth are interesting and will probably keep you engage enough to see the story to the end, but most of the game is bad shoot people gameplay. 

People will argue that the gameplay is bad because B:I got rid of basically all the RPG elements in Bioshock and also made the map design completely linear, but I disagree with this. These people don't remember that Bioshock already had shallow RPG mechanics and poor map design. The maps were design so that each path was a deadend that the player had to backtrack through once a mission was done... instead of making things loop around. This happens in B:I still, but the linearity negates most of it to optional missions. 

In B:I the vigors (plasmids) nearly all do the same thing (LMB to attack, RMB to make a trap) removing any strategy on which one to choose and removing any reason to mix them together (which atleast Bioshock had). You also can only hold 2 weapons, which ruins any chance of mixing up the gameplay. Like you have limited resources so you have to choose wisely on what weapons to upgrade so you'll probably only hold the same 2 weapons you've upgraded through the game because if you upgraded a 3rd weapon you won't be able to use it unless you randomly find it on the ground in the middle of the fight. 

Also since you don't have an inventory Elizabeth will randomly throw you items that you need during a fight which means there isn't really any strategy to refilling your health/magic in the middle of combat. Yes there are items that have small refilling benefits but that doesn't replace potions. You also can buy refill potions that are applied instantly and also random refill areas in combat arenas so just abuse these locations?

But while they basically stripped down the gameplay to a bare FPS minimum, I think it was a step in the right direction for these developers. But they needed to go one step further, remove the gameplay entirely. Seriously, if this was a Themepark Simulator there would have been more time to flesh out the narrative, characters, and setting which the game greatly needed.

I played the game on medium and I would not recommend playing it on higher difficulties because there are bullet sponge enemies and the only boss fight in the game is a bullet sponge that infinitely spawns enemies in which you fight the boss multiple times. 

I can't recommend this game because of the poor gameplay. I would recommend instead watching an LP (Let's Play or Long Play depending on your perspective c;) and buying some cool looking merchandise from Irrational Games instead https://store.irrationalgames.com/
